--- title: "Welcome" description: | A blog on the NSC-R Workshops. author: - name: Wim Bernasco, Alex Trinidad, Asier Moneva and Sam Langton url: https://nscr.nl affiliation: NSCR preview: workshop.png date: June 6 2021 output: distill::distill_article: self_contained: false --- ![](workshop.png){out.width="50%"}
This blog serves as an agenda for future workshop meetings and as an archive for past workshop meetings. Each post: - briefly describes date, time and topic of a workshop - provides the Zoom link where you can join the workshop meeting - lists any necessary suggested pre-workshop reading material - introduces the workshop presenter - provides links to the workshop materials provided by the presenter - provides links to additional information on the workshop topic ### Open sources that may help you learn about R in general - Grolemund, G. & Wickham, H. (2019). [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/) - Batra, N. (ed, 2021). [The Epidemiologist R Handbook](https://epirhandbook.com/index.html) - Baumer, B.S., Kaplan, D.T. & Horton, N.J. (2018). [Modern Data Science with R](https://mdsr-book.github.io/mdsr2e/) - Irizarry, R.A. (2019). [Introduction to Data Science. Data Analysis and Prediction Algorithms with R](https://rafalab.github.io/dsbook/) - Kaplan, J. (2021). [Crime by the Numbers: A Criminologist's Guide to R](https://crimebythenumbers.com/) - Navarro, D. (2019). [Learning statistics with R: A tutorial for psychology students and other beginners](https://learningstatisticswithr.com/book/)
